Q_DESC:
Today Gardener wants to clean his garden. Gardener has N columns of ground. Each column has its height . Gardener can choose any column and increase its height by 1 using 1 cube of ground.

Gardener wants to spend exactly M cubes. Can he make this in such way that the heights of all columns will become equal?
Input

    First line of input contains an integer T denoting number of test cases.
    Then for each test case, The first line contains two integers N and M.
    The second line contains N space-separated integers A1, A2, ..., AN denoting the initial heights of the columns".

Output

    If Gardener can spend all cubes and make the columns equal print Yes else print No.

Constraints

    1<=T<=10^2
    1<=N<=10^2
    1<=Ai <=10^2
    0<=M<=10^4
